topic.title: Is there a riseup.net kind of site here on ZeroNet ?
Wikipedia on ZeroNet
topic.body:
Each "free" person can download a snapshot of Wikipedia (60 GB, 15 GB compressed). From my point of view (as non-coder) it would be nice "project" for ZeroNet to upload, sync (with an acceptable delay) and make this knowledge base accessible for everyone, especially for https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Censorship_of_Wikipedia

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Database_download

A) What do you think?
B) Technically possible, issues... ?

topic.title: What's your opinion about GNUnet and Lokinet ?

1564584559_1FvUoTBvkBv4vgfpxGLEu4ggPJje4.body:
> [fondulac](#comment_3_17FTEKfnFVM6XGctStcwZLue3N8BxHbrmz): Notes on config: Don't modify the Whonix gateway. For the fileserver_ip use 10.152.152.11. Enable Tor  always and use Syncronite http://127.0.0.1:43110/15CEFKBRHFfAP9rmL6hhLmHoXrrgmw4B5o/ for your tracker sync. I user Tor as the tracker proxy and have 32/61 trackers connected. In terminal when starting Zeronet use --force_encryption, --download_option auto, --db_mode security, --fix_float_decimals True, --msgpack_purepython True, --stream_downloads True, --use_tempfiles True, --force_encryption, --filesever_ip 10.152.152.11. If it bogs your system down back away from decimals, msgpack, stream, and tempfiles and try again. The form generally is ./ZeroNet-py3/zeronet.py --options --options --options. I wrote this because there is a gap between developers and users. Developers understand the cli so well that they don't explain simple formatting that users generally don't know how to do. Ask questions if you have them and I will try to answer them. Good luck!

A. What does  --fix_float_decimals {True,False} "Fix content.json modification date float precision on verification (default: False)" do exactly (for non-coders) ? 
B. What does --db_mode security do ?

What are the pros and cons of these options ?

> [kaffie](#comment_866_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): ZN transmits the site files. ISPs AFAIK can see this. Though TOR can be used in the usual fashion. ISPs also have the ability to see which IP you connect to (which a VPN or TOR can help protect against). The usual stuff basically.  [...]

Thanks for all your explanations.

1565166240_1CN9rdrWkKbk8EmDSQNZZrwGmd8Tv.body:
> [kaffie](#comment_867_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): ZeroMail? I'm not familiar with what riseup.net does, or what you're looking for.

Riseupâ€™s Purpose

[...]

    We value, support, and engage in struggles for human liberation, the ethical treatment of animals, and ecological sustainability. We join in the fight for freedom and the self-determination of all oppressed groups. We oppose all forms of prejudice, authoritarianism, and vanguardism.

    We organize on the basis of autonomy, mutual aid, resource sharing, participatory knowledge, social advocacy, anti-oppression work, community creation, and secure communication.

    We work to create revolution and a free society in the here and now by building alternative communication infrastructure designed to oppose and replace the dominant system.

    We promote social ownership and democratic control over information, ideas, technology, and the means of communication.

    We empower organizations and individuals to use technology in struggles for liberation. We work to support each other in overcoming the systemic oppression embedded in the use and development of technology.

1565231801_1Gp6bE82nhuD8RJZaJqTJSgUozLHq.body:

https://twitter.com/dash_venezuela
https://www.dash.org/news

I wont' start a crypto talk here it just came into my mind reading "Venezuela"

Good luck dude ! I hope things will improve in Venezuela soon

1565256550_149W17bFN1NbQou6iE81Uq2b8wEvy.body:
friend-to-friend (F2F) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friend-to-friend
this could be extended / linked to sites and auto-download / preview permissions etc.

> [zerowatchdog](#comment_7_1CN9rdrWkKbk8EmDSQNZZrwGmd8TvVbgjM): friend-to-friend (F2F) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friend-to-friendthis could be extended / linked to sites and auto-download / preview permissions etc.

with https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_of_trust
making friends, groups ... trusted networks

Additionally, I would like to see a user ranking based on "likes", posts and/or relationship (trust level). Maybe something like https://steemit.com/faq.html#Does_it_cost_anything_to_post__comment__or_vote but without crypto money. As a result it could be a kind of social self-regulated ecosystem. Limits trolls and haters, supports ZeroNet to gain value by good content.

1565346520_1CN9rdrWkKbk8EmDSQNZZrwGmd8Tv.body:
> [caryoscelus](#comment_183_13oRBYqNeUr6Tvgt4KkAT9FT4XRiKFBjnE): Kiwipedia already exists, though i've no idea how hard it is to actually import/update articles

Thanks for the link ! I will check it out...

> [tinktinktink](#comment_9_15QMtSMe3Ckgr3m3bajRgDbNsChibX6sK4): It's probably possible and would be a nice experiment for large websites.I don't think people would be willing to contribute 15-60 GB of space to it, though.

Yes, you are probably right... but some would do so... Like hdidnothingwrong said it is not so much money. Anyway, I have a Raspberry wait for a next project ;)

> [fodase](#comment_20_16cMkqz45EzZSjYqk37UTVXaYqLLtrXf3r): Most of the edits on Wikipedia are made by corporations and governments. Here's an example :https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Congressional_staff_edits_to_Wikipedia [...]

Indeed interesting, I did some research on the clear net and I found some good news article explaining the current financing model and the pro and cons of alternatives like ads.

Google and Amazon is doing big donations but Google, Alexa and others use Wikipedia for their services and to train their AI...

Wikipedia had (has) a very good mission I hope users and writers see the risk drifting towards the big G and others. 

For me if I compare pro and cons I still see Wikipedia as high value for our open and free society. Nowadays, we cannot work with Brockhaus encyclopedia anymore.

> [myriri](#comment_5_145qVnMUHFaHhDNmmd1s2ZPh5FTArtZmjn): I find that for scientific and technical subjects wikipedia is relatively reliable.And I suspect there will come a day when this information is restricted to the general public.

I agree a good help for scientific and tech. investigations. 
Worth to contribute, storage and share it.

1565855060_1CN9rdrWkKbk8EmDSQNZZrwGmd8Tv.body:
It is absolutely ok to fork code that's part of open source. Let's see if they can do (even) better - Zeronet is not perfect, now. GNUnet has very good concepts like GNS and re:claimID but I was also not able get everything running...

Who has really tested one of these / hosted sites / supported the development ?
Please share your  experiences.
